content.question:
A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION.

You are permitted to use your calculator to solve an equation, find the derivative of a function at a point, or calculate the value of a definite integral. However, you must clearly indicate the setup of your question, namely the equation, function, or integral you are using. If you use other built-in features or programs, you must show the mathematical steps necessary to produce your results. Your work must be expressed in standard mathematical notation rather than calculator syntax.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table, with 4 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “g of x.” The heading for row 3 is “g prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is negative 1. g of x is 4. g prime of x is negative 2. Column 2. x is 0. g of x is 1. g prime of x is negative 6. Column 3. x is 2. g of x is 0. g prime of x is negative 3. Column 4. x is 3. g of x is negative 2. g prime of x is negative 4."><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

The table above gives selected values for a differentiable and decreasing function <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative. Let <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function with <math alttext="f of 3 equals 2 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and derivative given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals x times the cosine of, open parenthesis, e to the x power, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Find <math alttext="f double prime of, open parenthesis, the sine of 2, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Express your answer as a decimal approximation.

frqParts.text:
A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION.

You are permitted to use your calculator to solve an equation, find the derivative of a function at a point, or calculate the value of a definite integral. However, you must clearly indicate the setup of your question, namely the equation, function, or integral you are using. If you use other built-in features or programs, you must show the mathematical steps necessary to produce your results. Your work must be expressed in standard mathematical notation rather than calculator syntax.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table, with 4 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “g of x.” The heading for row 3 is “g prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is negative 1. g of x is 4. g prime of x is negative 2. Column 2. x is 0. g of x is 1. g prime of x is negative 6. Column 3. x is 2. g of x is 0. g prime of x is negative 3. Column 4. x is 3. g of x is negative 2. g prime of x is negative 4."><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

The table above gives selected values for a differentiable and decreasing function <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative. Let <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function with <math alttext="f of 3 equals 2 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and derivative given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals x times the cosine of, open parenthesis, e to the x power, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Find <math alttext="f double prime of, open parenthesis, the sine of 2, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Express your answer as a decimal approximation.

(b)   Let <math alttext="h"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="h of x, equals, g of, open parenthesis, f of 2 x, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="h prime of 1.5"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Express your answer as a decimal approximation.

(c)   Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="g inverse"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the inverse function of <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, at <math alttext="x equals negative 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(d)   The point <math alttext="with coordinates 3 comma 1 "><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> lies on the curve in the <math alttext="x y"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane given by the equation <math alttext="open parenthesis, f of x, close parenthesis, squared, plus, g of x, equals, x y minus 1"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x "><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> at the point <math alttext="with coordinates 3 comma 1"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Express your answer as a decimal approximation.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
